intro: Heptapleurum laeve, commonly known as the smooth heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Actinidiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of China, where it thrives in temperate climates. The plant is characterized by its large, leathery leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Heptapleurum laeve is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and hardy nature.
